page.main-description: Experienced full-stack software engineer proficient in diverse technologies and frameworks. Passionate about solving complex problems and delivering high-quality applications. Continuously learning and adapting to industry advancements.
page.work-description: Rodrigo is a full-cycle software engineer and cloud associate based in Brazil, with a passion for building scalable and reliable systems. He possesses a strong background in developing, maintaining, and deploying payment systems and programs. Currently, his focus lies in exploring cloud solutions and their practical applications in solving real-life problems.
page.education-description: One and a half years before securing his first job as a programmer, Rodrigo embarked on his software engineering journey by enrolling in the esteemed software engineering course at Uni-FACEF. Since then, he has diligently pursued practical experience through independent studies, separate from his academic and professional commitments. - For more details, explore the certifications section on my LinkedIn profile.

angolist.title: Angolist
angolist.description: A React Native project utilizing AsyncStorage for local data storage and retrieval.

ddos.title: DDOs project
ddos.description: A Go project leveraging goroutines to concurrently handle multiple data streams, enabling efficient and parallel processing.

ds-movie.title: Angolist
ds-movie.description: A Java project with a front-end and a back-end implemented using Java Spring for server-side functionality.

irroba.title: Development and Support Internship
irroba.point-1: Investigating and resolving issues reported by users or customers.
irroba.point-2: Creating and maintaining technical documentation, including user guides, API documentation, and internal knowledge bases.
irroba.point-3: Work on fixing bugs and addressing software defects.

q2.title: Full Stak Developement
q2.point-1: Developing and maintaining web applications using React.js and other related technologies.
q2.point-2: Collaborating with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and other developers to create high-quality products.
q2.point-3: Implementing responsive design and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
q2.point-4: Participating in code reviews and providing constructive feedback to other developers.

unimed.title: Mobile Developement
unimed.point-1: Implement pipelines and increase test coverages by testing its functionalities.
unimed.point-2: Contribute to enhancing the software by implementing new features and functionality.
unimed.point-3: Manage and work with UI/UX teams to design and implement payments solutions and dashboards.
unimed.point-4: Deploy environments and its envs in order to delivery white-label solutions.
